column4: is there a way to get transmission-daemon to be able to write to a samba share?

i think that would make reduce the issue to simply pointing transmission-daemon at your smbfs mount point
i have it mounted via fstab (the linux is actually a guest virtualbox machine)
so your smbfs mount point is something like /media/blah and transmission won't write to /media/blah/torrents ?
its actually in /home/user/blah but yea
ah so you have it mounted in your home folder... ok. my next thought would be that some user permissions relating to the vbox and the user account running in vbox might need looking at ?
hmmmm
your current problem is just that transmission wont write to your samba share right ?
yes, i have a feeling that its because transmission-daemon has its own user
true if its run as root
no its actually got its own user "transmission-daemon"
ok have a look at creating a group for samb virtual box sharing ... somthing like "smb-vbox" and place yourself, virtualbox and the transmission daemon in that group ?

ok so virtualbox isn't part of the permissions problem but you understand my point ?
yes i do understand
i have already added transmission-daemon to the samba group
i think you'd be better off leavign system groups alone and isolating the situation to custom groups
i shuffled the mount point to the /media folder, im checking now
true, but otherwise transmission-daemon wouldnt be able to use samba services
thats the point of smbfs, that it doesnt realise that it is using samba... all it sees is a folder.
